Project.name: PureMVC Standard for Objective C
Project.Description: PureMVC is a lightweight framework for creating applications based upon the classic Model-View-Controller design meta-pattern. This is the specific implementation for the Objective C language based on the Standard Version AS3 reference.
Project.ReleaseNotes: Summary of Changes in 1.1 Release for PureMVC / ObjectiveC 1.1 / iPhone SDK 3.0 (dot notation no longer works: http://forums.puremvc.org/index.php?topic=946.msg5838#msg5838) Features in 1.0 Compatible with the unit tests for the AS3 Standard 2.0.4 Reference implementation.
Project.Installation: Installation From the archive * Download the latest source code archive. * Unzip the source code zip to any folder on your disk. (for instance: ~/Dev) * You will see a PureMVC_ObjectiveC_X_Y (where X_Y is version) source folder. (for instance: ~/Dev/PureMVC_ObjectiveC_X_Y ) From the Repository * Use your favorite SVN client to retrieve the latest source code release from the repository. Examine the Contents Inside you will find * The API documentation: doc/html/index.html * The source code: src/org/puremvc/objectivec/... * The static library for use with iphone/ipod XCode projects: bin/PureMVC/PureMVC_ObjectiveC_X_Y.a * The header files for use with the static library in your iphone/ipod XCode projects: bin/PureMVC/headers Adding PureMVC to your XCode project To add the PureMVC static library and headers to your XCode project: * From the the Groups & Files pane, * Right click on the Frameworks folder (if it exists)... * ...or the Link Binary With Libraries folder * Select Add -> Existing Files... * Browse and Add the PureMVC static library: ( i.e. ~/Dev/PureMVC_ObjectiveC_X_Y/bin/PureMVC/PureMVC_ObjectiveC_X_Y.a ) For each target you added it too, you should see the static library (.a) listed in the Link Binary With Libraries folder. * From the Groups & Files pane, * Double click the respective target... * ...or right click and select Get Info * Click on the Build tab. * Under the setting, Header Search Paths, * Add the path to the PureMVC headers: ( i.e. ~/Dev/PureMVC_ObjectiveC_X_Y/bin/PureMVC/headers ) * Now you are good to code! Note: The static library has been compiled for the both the simulator and the device.

Project.name: PureMVC Objective C Standard Version Unit Tests
Project.Description: These are the unit tests for the PureMVC Objective C Standard Version.
Project.ReleaseNotes: Summary of Changes in 1.1 Release for PureMVC / ObjectiveC 1.1 / iPhone SDK 3.0 (dot notation no longer works: http://forums.puremvc.org/index.php?topic=946.msg5838#msg5838) Features in 1.0 Compatible with the unit tests for the AS3 Standard 2.0.4 Reference implementation.
Project.Installation: Installation From the archive * Download the latest source code archive. * Unzip the source code zip to any folder on your disk. (for instance: ~/Dev) * You will see a PureMVC_ObjectiveC_UnitTests_X_Y (where X_Y is version) source folder. (for instance: ~/Dev/PureMVC_ObjectiveC_UnitTests_X_Y ) From the Repository * Use your favorite SVN client to retrieve the latest source code release from the repository. Examine the Contents Inside you will find * The source code: src/org/puremvc/objectivec/... * The PureMVC static library used with the project: lib/PureMVC/PureMVC_ObjectiveC_X_Y.a * The header files for use with the static library: lib/PureMVC/headers Setup, Build, and Run the Unit Tests using XCode Create the Project * Create a new XCode Project called PureMVCUnitTests. * Make sure to choose the template: Mac OS X : Other : Empty Project Create the Target * From the Groups & Files pane, * Right click on Targets * Select Add -> New Target * Name it PureMVCUnitTests * Make sure to choose the template: Mac OS X : Cocoa : Unit Test Bundle Add the Source Folder * From the Groups & Files pane, * Right click on top level PureMVCUnitTests project folder * Select Add -> Existing Files... * Browse and Add the project source folder ( i.e. ~/Dev/PureMVC_ObjectiveC_UnitTests_X_Y/src ) Add the PureMVC Static Library * From the Groups & Files pane, * Under the target PureMVCUnitTests, * Right click on the Link Binary With Libraries folder * Select Add -> Existing Files... * Browse and Add the PureMVC static library ( i.e. ~/Dev/PureMVC_ObjectiveC_UnitTests_X_Y/lib/PureMVC/PureMVC_ObjectiveC_X_Y.a ) Add the PureMVC Headers * From the Groups & Files pane, * Double click the PureMVCUnitTests target... * ...or right click and select Get Info * Click on the Build tab. * Under the setting, Header Search Paths, * Add the path to the PureMVC headers ( i.e. ~/Dev/PureMVC_ObjectiveC_UnitTests_X_Y/lib/PureMVC/headers ) Build the Project * From the Build File menu, * Choose Build Results and then click the small icon at the bottom of the top pane that looks like a written paragraph (hover reads: Select this to show or hide the build transcript). * Increase the height of the build transcript pane. * Click the Build button (hammer) at the top of the Build Results window, you should see the tests running and results.
